args:
The prince and his siblings embark upon the
maiden voyage of a state-of-the-art new ship.
But when a storm strikes and sinks the vessel,
the prince finds himself stranded on a deserted
island, putting his survival skills to the test.
Behold the splendor of the grand city\nof Spunopolis, located on the isthmus\nconnecting North and South Grastaea!
Just look at all the people coming and\ngoing. The energy here is so vibrant.
Indeed. May I now present to you the pride\nof this city: the newly constructed Titan!\nToday it departs on its maiden voyage.
You worked with the locals on the ship's\nconstruction, right, Chelle?

Eee hee hee! I wouldn't go so far as to say
I cooperatedâ€”I merely offered a bit of
engineering know-how and capital to
support the project.
I see you all have been invited\nto today's ceremony as well.
Leondias! What are you doing here?\nAnd...what in the world are you wearing?
Pick up your jaw. It's just a swimsuit.\nAre you not all attired similarly?
I mean, yes, but I didn't really think\nyou...you know, did stuff like that.
All of the project's biggest investors have\nbeen invited to a special party at the ship's\non-board pool.
And in ï¼‚suitableï¼‚ fashionâ€”hehâ€”the\ninvitation requested that attendees wear\nclothes they would not mind getting wet.

As they say: when at the pool, do as the
swimmers do. It would be a disgrace for
the eldest son of the royal family to fail
to adhere to a simple dress code.
Ahem. I've been wearing my own swimsuit\nthis entire time, and neither of you have so\nmuch as commented on it.

Honestly... When a lady of some caliber
graces your presence clad in resplendent
summerwear, you should be bending over
backwards to offer her refulgent praise!
I...I see. I'll remember that for next time.
Hmph. I need not waste my flattery on my\nsister.
Now what's all this racket over here?
What theâ€”{player_name}?! And\nLeonidas and Chelle?! What in the blazing\nsummer sun are YOU people doing here?
I see you're in usual form, Emile.
I daresay he was only invited to the\nsend-off and NOT to the party.
There is such a thing as hierarchy even\namong distinguished guests, to be sure.
Now see here! What's THAT supposed to\nmean?!
You and Chelle are one thing, but you\ncould not POSSIBLY be insinuating\nthat {player_name} is above me!
Um, I'm just here because Chelle brought\nme along.
Given that mere HANGERS-ON are clearly\npermitted to attend, why should I, the\nEMPEROR, be barred from the party?
I suspect you might find the answer to\nthat in your boorish bravado.
But if you absolutely insist upon it, Emile,\nI could speak to the organizers for you.
What?! Seriously?! Bwuhâ€”I mean, at this\npoint, I cannot say I have all that much\nINTEREST in attending your little soiree...
But seeing as my siblings would so clearly\nbe heartbroken without my presence, I can\ndeign to give the idea some thought.
Don't let him drag you down. The four of us\ndon't get together like this often, so let's\ntry to get along without quarreling.
I tire of this drivel. I'm leaving. If you lot\ninsist on frolicking about, do it once our\nvoyage is in progress.
With that, we clambered aboard the docked\nTitan and waited until it set sail at last.
The party at the ship's pool was a pleasant affair.\nFor the first time in a long time, a few peaceful\nhours passed me by without incident.
But no sooner had I silently expressed my thanks\nfor this respite than the weather grew turbulent.
Waves battered the ship, throwing the crew into\na panic. We were at the mercy of the sea...
Where...am I?\nI remember the ship sinking...
(No response. And there's not a man-made\nstructure in sight. In fact, there's no sign of\nhabitation at all. Oh... Oh, no.)
The ship was consumed by the raging sea, and I\nwas thrown overboard, only to wash ashore on a\ndeserted island.
Well, only one thing to do now.
I'll start by canvassing the area.\nIt's entirely possible that other\npeople washed ashore here, too.
I really hope Leonidas and Chelle are\nall right...
